abstract.p: Scott Isler letter on Stephen Holden's June 18 article holds reason for current dearth of satirical films is that Hollywood now caters to teenagers and children (S)

block.p: Stephen Holden asks why satirical films are currently unpopular [''Satire Is Dying for Our Sins,'' June 18], but he touches on, then ignores, the most obvious answer: in the 1960's, Mr. Holden writes, ''American movie audiences could recognize and savor a dark social comedy.'' Just whom does Hollywood cater to today? Teenagers and their younger siblings aren't exactly the target demographic for sophisticated humor. No wonder the recent films Mr. Holden cites vanished upon release. There were probably fewer explosions in all of them combined than in the first reel of ''M:I-2.''
